alert.note: Alert for Washington Palouse (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 7:29PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Latah and east central Whitman Counties through 800 PM PDT... At 729 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Potlatch to 8 miles southeast of Deary. Movement was northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Troy, Potlatch, Deary, Bovill, Palouse, Garfield, Onaway, Harvard, Princeton, Helmer, and Viola. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 349 and 368. U.S. Highway 195 in Washington near mile marker 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
